io.customerly

Class Customerly

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.customerly.Customerly

  • public class Customerly
extends java.lang.Object
    The singleton representing the Customerly SDK

    • Method Detail

      • get

        @NonNull
public static Customerly get()
        Call this method to obtain the reference to the Customerly SDK
        Returns:
        The Customerly SDK instance reference

      • configure

        public static void configure(@NonNull
                             android.app.Application pApplication,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String pCustomerlyAppID)
        Call this method to configure the SDK indicating the Customerly App ID before accessing it.
        Call this from your custom Application Application.onCreate()
        Parameters:
        pApplication - The application class reference
        pCustomerlyAppID - The Customerly App ID found in your Customerly console

      • configure

        public static void configure(@NonNull
                             android.app.Application pApplication,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String pCustomerlyAppID,
                             int pWidgetColor)
        Call this method to configure the SDK indicating the Customerly App ID before accessing it.
        Call this from your custom Application Application.onCreate()

        You can choose to ignore the widget_color provided by the Customerly web console for the action bar styling in support activities and use an app-local widget_color instead.
        Parameters:
        pApplication - The application class reference
        pCustomerlyAppID - The Customerly App ID found in your Customerly console
        pWidgetColor - The custom widget_color. If Color.TRANSPARENT, it will be ignored

      • setVerboseLogging

        public void setVerboseLogging(boolean pVerboseLogging)
        Call this method to enable error logging in the Console. Avoid to enable it in release app versions, the suggestion is to pass your.application.package.BuildConfig.DEBUG as parameter
        Parameters:
        pVerboseLogging - true for enable logging, please pass your.application.package.BuildConfig.DEBUG

      • update

        @CheckResult
 @NonNull
public Customerly.UpdateTask update()
        Call this method to build a task that force a check for pending Surveys or Message for the current user.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Returns:
        The builded task that has to be started with his method Customerly.__Task.start()

      • registerUser

        @CheckResult
 @NonNull
public Customerly.RegisterUserTask registerUser(@NonNull
                                                                       java.lang.String email)
        Call this method to build a task that links your app user to the Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address of the user
        Returns:
        The builded task that has to be started with his method Customerly.__Task.start()

      • setAttributes

        @CheckResult
 @NonNull
public Customerly.SetAttributesTask setAttributes(@NonNull
                                                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> pAttributes)
                                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Call this method to build a task that add new custom attributes to the user.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        pAttributes - Optional attributes for the user. Can contain only String, char, int, long, float or double values
        Returns:
        The builded task that has to be started with his method Customerly.__Task.start()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if the attributes check fails

      • setCompany

        @CheckResult
 @NonNull
public Customerly.SetCompanyTask setCompany(@NonNull
                                                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> pCompany)
                                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Call this method to build a task that add company attributes to the user.
        The map must contain a String value with key "company_id" containing to the Company ID and a String value with key "name" containing the Company name

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        pCompany - Optional company for the user. The map must contain a String value with key "company_id" containing to the Company ID and a String value with key "name" containing the Company name
        Returns:
        The builded task that has to be started with his method Customerly.__Task.start()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if company map check fails

      • openSupport

        public void openSupport(@NonNull
                        android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this method to open the Support Activity.
        A call to this method will force the enabling if the support logic if it has been previously disabled with setSupportEnabled(boolean)
        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        activity - The current activity

      • logoutUser

        public void logoutUser()
        Call this method to close the user's Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)

      • trackEvent

        public void trackEvent(@NonNull
                       java.lang.String pEventName)
        Call this method to keep track of custom labelled events.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        pEventName - The event custom label

      • setSupportEnabled

        public void setSupportEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Call this method to disable or enable the message receiving. It is ENABLED by default.
        A call to the method openSupport(Activity) will force the enabling if it is disabled
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if you want to enable it, false otherwise

      • setSurveysEnabled

        public void setSurveysEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Call this method to disable or enable the survey receiving. It is ENABLED by default.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if you want to enable it, false otherwise

      • disableOn

        public void disableOn(java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> activityClass)
        Call this method to specify an Activity that will never display a message popup or survey.
        Every Activity is ENABLED by default
        Parameters:
        activityClass - The Activity class
        See Also:
        enableOn(Class)

      • enableOn

        public void enableOn(java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> activityClass)
        Call this method to re-enable an Activity previously disabled with disableOn(Class).
        Parameters:
        activityClass - The Activity class
        See Also:
        disableOn(Class)
